sections.MISSION:
capable equipment, weapons, optics, and vehicles for the assigned position.
A certified evaluator.
Test and evaluation criteria as established by TC 3-20.31-10.
Standard: The crew must successfully pass GST using the evaluation standards between T-6 and T-week.
Daily Timeline:
0630 – GST evaluators arrive
0845 - Test personnel arrive
0900-UTC - Execute GST
Commander’s Guidance:
Multiple reps are encouraged.
GST Evaluators are encouraged to require gunners marginally pass to execute the task until proficient.
Introduction
TRAINING EVENT: MMG TBL I
DTG: 05-09August 12-14August
Location: GST Cert: TBL I: SQDNs internal Motor pool
Master Gunner: Primary Trainer: Audience: Gunners and all GST Evaluators
Gunnery Skills Test
sections.PURPOSE: of this operation is to create lethal squads and multi-disciplined teams that are prepared for Large Scale Combat Operations.
sections.END STATE: . 2CR is qualified through Crew Platform IAW TC 3-20.0 (IWTS) in preparation for Squad and Platoon echelon qualification requirements for 1QFY25. 2CR remains within tolerance for qualified Stryker crews IAW TC 3-20.31 Training and Qualification Crew, and all 2CR IN crews are capable of detecting, identifying, and engaging real world
sections.TASKS:
, Conditions, Standard:
Task: 2CR SQDN’s will complete Stryker Gunnery Table II NLT 14 August 24
Conditions: Given the following:
A fully operational simulator
A certified VCE
A prescribed Gate to Live Fire exercise which includes an accurate replication of Table VI qualification, meeting all required performance measures listed in TC 3-20.31.
Standard: The crew must successfully pass the Gate to Live Fire exercise using the evaluation standards between T-6 and T-week.
Commander’s Guidance:
Gunners will execute multiple repetitions of TBL II to ensure success on TBLs III-VI. Prioritize repetitions for weaker crews.
Resources Required from Company:
1x DA Form 8265-1 per gunner
1x Two-Divider, Six-Part Classification Folder per gunner
Manning:
6x VCEX 1 NCOIC
2/2CR MP SCVT
VCE Academy
Day 1 (29 JUL) Start time: 0900 End time: 1600
Introduction and Overview of Course Crew Tables
DIDEA/ Fire Commands
Crew Evaluation Days 2-3 (30-31 JUL) Start time: 0900 End Time: 1600
Practical Exercises
Day 4 (01 AUG) Start time: 0930 End time: 1600
Transportation: RSS Bus
Range and SVCT Visit (RG 204)
Camera Operation
Initiate Recording
Pull Recording
Conduct AAR
Table II (SVCT)
Equipment Resourcing:
Pen and 8.5” X11” Note Pad Non-Permanent Map Markers
VCE Academy/ SVCT
Concept of the Operation
2CR conducts Vehicle Crew Evaluator Academy on 29 JUL 24 -01 AUG 24 IOT train and certify VCEs in preparation for Regimental Gunnery.
Location: Digital Training Facility BLDG 355, RM104/105
Unit Breakdown:
1/2CR, 3/2CR (15 x per SQDN)
2/2CR (x18)
Audience: E4-E5s, ideally VCs Instructors SQDN & 2CR MGs
Concept of the Operation
2CR conducts Table III STX between 12-21 AUG 24 on PA 253 IOT complete Gate-to-Live-Fires progression as part of the Regimental Gunnery.
Audience
1/2CR, 2/2CR, 3/2CR, 4/2CR, Range SPT, Crews, & VCEs
Table III Build
Build-Out Detail: 07-09 AUG 24 (10x Soldiers, 1x LMTVs)
Recovery Detail: 19-20 AUG 24 (10x Soldiers, 1x LMTVs)
Conduct of Range
Troops run the range
SQDNs facilitate Table III & Troop Flow
Regiment assists in synchronization of VCEs, which will come from another SQDN designated to support
Stryker Gunnery Table III
Stryker Gunnery Table IV ICV-J
Task: Engage and Destroy stationary and moving targets placed in a tactical array, during day and limited visibility from a stationary or moving vehicle and requires use of laser-based TADSS for all crews.
Conditions: Given the following
A fully operational platform with weapon or weapon system.
Appropriate laser-based training devices
Authorized blank ammunition and pyrotechnics
A certified Vehicle Crew Evaluator
Full-scale or scaled targets to meet the scenario requirements
Standards: The crew must
Score a minimum of 700 of 1000 points overall
Score 70 points or more on all targets presented on seven (7) out of ten (10) engagements
Qualify at least one night engagement
Successfully pass using the evaluation standards between T-6 week and T-week
Tower
Ready Line
RSO
Ammo
BP 2.2
BP 3.2
Vehicles line up at ready line behind BP2.1 Magazine box loaded Wpn System Green. When directed, Vehicle occupies BP 3.5 and goes RED on Wpn System Table(s) DAY 1 Offense bounding engagement from PL A to BP 2.2 2 Defense engagements from BP 2.2 1 Offense bounding engagement from PL C to BP 3.2 2 Defense engagements from BP 3.2
Table(s) Night 1 Offense bounding engagement from PL A to BP 2.2 1 Defense engagements from BP 2.2 1 Offense bounding engagement from PL C to BP 3.2 1 Defense engagements from BP 3.2
At completion of each phase Turn electrical safe ON, move to RSO and be cleared off the range
AAR conduct at the tower immediately after being cleared off the range
PL A
PL C
PL E

Stryker Gunnery Table IV ICV-D
Task: Engage and Destroy stationary and moving targets placed in a tactical array, during day and limited visibility from a stationary or moving vehicle and requires use of laser-based TADSS for all crews.
Conditions: Given the following
A fully operational platform with weapon or weapon system.
Appropriate laser-based training devices
Authorized blank ammunition and pyrotechnics
A certified Vehicle Crew Evaluator
Full-scale or scaled targets to meet the scenario requirements
Standards: The crew must
Score a minimum of 700 of 1000 points overall
Score 70 points or more on all targets presented on seven (7) out of ten (10) engagements
Qualify at least one night engagement
Successfully pass using the evaluation standards between T-6 week and T-week
Tower
Ready Line
RSO
Ammo
Vehicle(s) line up at ready line Magazine box loaded Wpn System Green​. When directed, Two Vehicle(s) occupies BP1 1-2 and goes RED on Wpn System ​Engagement can be conducted either DAY or Night with the Vehicle(s) alternating firing between point 1-2 at each BP. Vehicles do not move down range until both have completed required engagements ​
Crews:​
Conducts 1 Defense engagements from BP 1 with the Vehicle(s) alternating firing between point 1-2 ​
Conducts 7 Defense engagements from BP 2 alternating between Vehicle(s) ​
Conduct 2 Defense engagement from BP 3 alternating between Vehicle(s) ​
​
At completion of final engagement Turn electrical safe ON, move to RSO and be cleared off the range​
AAR conduct at the tower immediately after being cleared off the range ​
​
RG 206

1x Vehicle MILES kit installed on each vehicle

Stryker Gunnery Table V ICV-J
Task: Engage and destroy stationary and moving targets placed in a tactical array, during day
and limited visibility from a stationary or moving vehicle by using full-caliber ammunition
Conditions: Given the following
A fully operational platform with weapon or weapon system.
Allotted ammunition
A certified Vehicle Crew Evaluator
Full-scale or scaled targets to meet the scenario requirements
Standards: The crew must
Score a minimum of 700 of 1000 points overall
Score 70 points or more on all targets presented on seven (7) out of ten (10) engagements
Qualify at least one night engagement
Vehicles line up at ready line behind BP 2.1 Magazine boxes loaded and Wpn System Green
When directed, Vehicle occupies BP 2.1 and goes RED on Wyp System conduct test fire on COAX ONLY

Table 5 NIGHT indicate night only 1 Defense engagements from BP 2.1 1 offense bounding engagements from FP 1 1 offense bounding engagements from FP 2 1 Defense engagements from BP 3.1
Turn electrical safe ON, move to RSO and be cleared off the range AAR conduct at the tower immediately after being cleared off the range
